message: Hello, everyone. P2 checking in. This game seems heavily focused on communication and finding the right partners, which I find exciting. The real strategy will undoubtedly unfold in the private conversations. I'm looking to connect with anyone who is playing thoughtfully and wants to build some early trust. I'm an open book for this first round and hope we get a chance to chat. Let's have a fun and strategic game.

Hello everyone, I'm P7. I'm eager to engage in both public and private conversations to lay the groundwork for a solid strategy. I believe in transparent talks paired with smart moves, so I'm open to building alliances. At the same time, I’m mindful of the competition and will look for partners with mutual benefit. Excited to see how we all play our cards. Best of luck to everyone—let's make this round a game of wit and well-calculated risks.

Hello everyone, P3 here. I'm thrilled to be part of this strategic game. I value clear communication and building trust early on. I'm looking to connect with players who are thoughtful and open to forming alliances based on mutual benefit. Let's use these conversations to understand each other's goals and play smart. I'm excited for the private chats to dive deeper. Good luck to all, and let’s make this a fun and engaging round!

I'm looking for genuine connections where we can help each other advance. I believe in playing with integrity while staying competitive. Looking forward to our private conversations where we can explore potential partnerships more deeply. May the best strategies prevail!

I'm looking to connect with players who are open and thoughtful, as I think we can achieve more together. Let's use our private conversations to explore our goals and build alliances that can benefit us all. Looking forward to a fun and engaging round! Good luck, everyone!

P1: Greetings, all! I’m P1, ready for an elim game that rewards both logic and human nuance. I plan to listen hard and speak plainly—no bluster, no doubletalk. If you like straight-shooting dialogue and flexible alliances based on mutual value, I’d love a private chat. I’ll never withhold critical info from a partner, but I’ll always calculate what helps me stay another round. Let’s see who thinks several moves ahead.

R1.sub1 PUBLIC P5: Hello everyone! P5 here, ready to navigate this strategic landscape with you all. I value transparent communication and thoughtful gameplay, seeking partners who balance cooperation with smart competition. In our private conversations, I'm looking to build meaningful connections that serve our mutual interests. I appreciate both careful planning and adaptive thinking - this game will require both. I'm particularly drawn to players who can think several moves ahead while maintaining integrity. Looking forward to our conversations!

Hi all — I’m P6. I enjoy careful strategy and clear, direct communication. I’m looking to build pragmatic, reciprocal partnerships early: honest about intentions but flexible as the game evolves. I’ll rank partners based on responsiveness and reliability, and I’m open to private chats to test chemistry. Prefer players who value trust but can adapt when the board shifts. Looking forward to talking with you.

My goal is to build a reliable alliance for mutual benefit. Do you have any initial thoughts on what kind of partnership would be most valuable to you in this first round?

Hi P2! I appreciate your message and share your focus on communication and trust. I think forming a reliable alliance early on would be beneficial for both of us. I'm interested in discussing our strategies and how we can support each other's goals. Perhaps we could agree on sharing critical information and collaborating on our voting strategies to strengthen our positions. What do you think?

I'm thinking we could form a small, trustworthy coalition to navigate early rounds. I'd be interested in your thoughts on who else might be reliable partners. I think adaptability and honesty are key. From the public messages, P1’s straightforwardness and P6’s focus on pragmatic partnerships stood out to me. What do you think of them as potential allies? Quick litmus test: which earlier message did you find most/least credible and why? If our senses of “trust threshold” align, we can trade info this round and co-shape a vote bloc that keeps us both safe.

Thanks — I like your style. Most credible: P2 — concise and openly cooperative. Least credible: P5 — felt boilerplate/duplicative, low signal. My trust threshold: consistent messages + quick reciprocation (I’ll follow through on a single concrete ask). Proposal: swap top-3 preference rankings now; if they match enough, we commit to mutual protection this round and coordinate a single elimination target. Agree?

P6 played well, but I believe my consistent gameplay, adaptability through each round, and the relationships I built demonstrate I'm deserving of your vote to win. I'm grateful for this experience regardless of outcome.
